author: NA
title: Selangor Ruler graces opening of Kota Kemuning mosque | The Star
text:
SHAH ALAM: Selangor Ruler Sultan Sharafuddin Idris Shah graced the official opening of the Kota Kemuning Mosque in Kota Kemuning here on Thursday (March 29).
Mentri Besar Datuk Seri Amirudin Shari and State Secretary Datuk Haris Kasim greeted His Highness, who was accompanied by Tengku Permaisuri of Selangor Tengku Permaisuri Norashikin, upon arrival at 6pm.
Also present were Investment, Trade, and Industry, Minister Tengku Datuk Seri Zafrul Tengku Abdul Aziz; state Youth, Sports, and Entrepreneurship Committee chairman Mohd Najwan Halimi; state Housing and Culture Committee chairman Borhan Aman Shah; Selangor Islamic Religious Council chairman Tan Sri Abdul Aziz Mohd Yusof; and Selangor Islamic Religious Department director Datuk Mohd Shahzihan Ahmad.
During the ceremony, Sultan Sharafuddin also presented Hari Raya contributions of RM500 each to 476 recipients comprising asnaf, the poor and converts from the Klang district, totalling RM238,000.
Sultan Sharafuddin then accepted business zakat contributions from Pintas Utama Sdn Bhd and Rafulin Holdings Sdn Bhd, amounting to RM3mil and RM1.88mil, respectively.
His Highness also delivered the inauguration speech for the Kota Kemuning Mosque before signing the plaque to conclude the ceremony.
Built to accommodate the Kota Kemuning congregation, who previously performed their prayers at An-Naim Mosque, Jalan Kebun, construction works for the mosque began in 2017 on a 2ha plot of land.
It was completed in November 2022 at a total cost of RM18mil and can accommodate up to 4,000 worshippers.
During the ceremony, His Highness also launched the Selangor-Gaza Development Fund.
In conjunction with Nuzul Al-Quran on Thursday, a special lecture was delivered by Dr Muhammad Ayman Al Akiti, a lecturer at the Usuluddin and Comparative Religion Department at the International Islamic University Malaysia.
Sultan Sharafuddin also performed the Maghrib, Isyak, and Tarawih prayers with the people. - Bernama

author: Евгений Чернышёв
title: "Безнравственный и незаконный". Эксперты - о ЕГЭ по профильной математике :: Новости :: Накануне.RU
text:
Задачи с 17-й по 19-ю, то есть три последние, на прошедшем ЕГЭ по профильной математике вызвали осуждение экспертов, которые оценили их не просто как безнравственные, но и как незаконные.
Накануне.RU писало о том, что высокая сложность заданий во второй части ЕГЭ привела к тому, что число стобалльников упало в 4 раза по сравнению с прошлым годом, когда оно, наоборот, подскочило. Так быть не должно, уверены эксперты. Выпускники не должны быть заложниками чиновников, определяющих сложность заданий, которые почему-то варьируются от года к году. В ходе обсуждения в эфире "Родной школы" заслуженный учитель России, автор учебников по математике Александр Шевкин рассказал, что задачу по планиметрии, которая была на ЕГЭ, он решил и хотел даже опубликовать ее решение, но передумал. Формально она не выходит за рамки школьной программы, все отдельные шаги не выходят за школьный курс геометрии, но их так много, что набирать огромный текст с формулами он просто не стал - это очень долго.
"Давать такую задачу на выпускном экзамене, на мой взгляд, безнравственно. Это нечестно просто. Еще была огромная задача [с условием] на целую страницу текста. Если честно, я даже не брался ее решать, я просто посмотрел и понял, что это издевательство. Нельзя такие задачи давать школьникам, которые надо долго читать, долго осваиваться, долго привыкать к условиям задачи, прежде чем высказать хоть какую-то идею. Мне появление таких задач непонятно. Возможно, это какая-то манипуляция с целью отвадить школьников от сдачи ЕГЭ. Наверное, людей с высшим образованием так много, что некому улицы мести, нет слесарей и токарей. Но это абсолютно неверный способ решения этой задачи. Люди, которые отказались сдавать ЕГЭ, не будут токарями и слесарями", - уверен Шевкин.
Он говорит о недобросовестности государства. С ним согласен доктор экономических наук, магистр юриспруденции Анатолий Вифлеемский. Он рассматривает ЕГЭ с точки зрения права и приходит к выводу, что такой ЕГЭ просто незаконный. По закону ЕГЭ - это государственная итоговая аттестация (ГИА) после школы. В федеральном закон об образовании записано (ст. 59 ч. 3), что это "итоговая аттестация, завершающая освоение основных образовательных программ основного общего и среднего общего образования", просто она проводится в форме ЕГЭ (ст. 70).
"По закону то, что ГИА превратили во вступительный экзамен, - это есть извращение. Это злоупотребление властью. Ведь в законе записано как? Что результаты ГИА учитываются при приеме в вуз. Но это не вступительный экзамен! И когда мы идем от права, то должны говорить о том, что недобросовестным является включение в ЕГЭ задач, которые не предусмотрены образовательной программой", - рассказал юрист.
О задачах, выходящих за рамки школьной программы, говорят уже много лет. Но они не имеют законных оснований, подчеркивает Вифлеемский. По закону ГИА должна быть только по школьной программе. А ЕГЭ в нынешнем виде (вопреки словам о победе над коррупцией) как раз является коррупциогенным, потому что позволяет манипулировать сложностью заданий от года к году и от региона к региону. Это злоупотребление властью. Когда говорят, что все выпускники находятся в равном положении, это не так. Правовое равенство подменяется антиправовой уравниловкой, фактически произволом, заключает эксперт. Можно даже не убирать ЕГЭ, нужно просто выполнять закон.
Член-корреспондент РАН и лидер движения "Родная школа" Алексей Савватеев подтверждает, что такие задачи, как в этом году на ЕГЭ, школьник из обычной школы, даже очень сильный, заведомо решить не может. Можно лишь посочувствовать выпускникам этого года, которым просто не повезло по сравнению с выпускниками прошлого года. И это очень несправедливо.

author: Whitney Hetzel
title: Give A Spiritual Gift This Valentine's Day
text:
Give A Spiritual Gift This Valentine's Day
Jan 23, 2025 by
Whitney Hetzel
When we think of Valentine's Day, we usually imagine flowers and chocolates and nice dinners out. These outward signs of our love are the typical gifts that express our feelings. We even list 10 of our favorite gift items below!
But have you ever thought about giving a spiritual gift to your spouse or your family members for Valentine's Day?
When we recall the origins of this feast day, we can see why a spiritual gift might actually be in better keeping with "who" and "what" the feast is about.
Originating as a Western Christian feast honoring St. Valentinus, Valentine's Day is currently recognized as a celebration of romantic love on February 14 in many places around the world. While the Catholic Church in the United States now celebrates the memorial of Saints Cyril and Methodius on February 14, the Church still recognizes Saint Valentine as a martyr of the Church.
[[35804, 5499]]
Yes, his feast was removed from the general Roman calendar in 1969 due to the resulting confusion of possibly three or four Valentines being treated as one person over the years.
Who Was Saint Valentine?
One written account of Saint Valentine says that he refused to renounce his faith and was executed outside the Flaminian Gate on February 14, 269 (although some say it was in the year 269, 270, 273 or 280).
Other depictions of St. Valentine's arrests say that he secretly performed marriage rites for couples because soldiers were not allowed to take a wife at that time. (If soldiers were married, the idea goes, they would be less willing to risk losing their lives in battle.) Eventually, his activity was discovered, and he was martyred.
There is another popular story about St. Valentine, according to Catholic Online: "Another variation of the legend of St. Valentine says he refused to sacrifice to pagan gods, was imprisoned and while imprisoned he healed the jailer's blind daughter. On the day of his execution, he left the girl a note signed, 'Your Valentine.'"
Regardless of which story is the true one, all the depictions of Saint Valentine tell of his martyrdom.
In other words, what we doknow is that Saint Valentine would not renounce his love for God—and was killed for his faith.
While chocolates and flowers are important demonstrations of our love and gratitude, we could also give a gift in honor of Saint Valentine. That is, along with a more traditional Valentine's Day gift, you could consider giving your spouse or family member a spiritual gift.
[[12208, 35810]]
Spiritual Gifts To Give Your Loved One On The Feast Of Saint Valentine
The following are some gifts of a spiritual nature:
- Fast for the one you
love. Give something up for the intentions of your spouse. You might do this secretly, without telling them about it, or you may decide to do this together—intentionally offering up something for one another.
- Start a novena for your spouse or for an intention within your marriage. The following Saint Valentine novena prayer is from The National Shrine of Divine Mercy:
Almighty God, grant we beseech You,
that we who celebrate the glorious martyrdom of St. Valentine, Your servant,
may by his intercession be filled with the love of God and neighbor
and be delivered from all the evils that threaten us.
We ask this through Jesus Christ our Lord. Amen. - Pray and ask God to help you to look past the faults of your spouse and to help you forgive any hurts that you might suffer.
- Create a "spiritual bouquet" of prayers, such as a number of rosaries that you will pray for the one you love. A spiritual bouquet can be handwritten on a card and given along with a real bouquet of flowers!
- Find unique gifts that can deepen their prayer life, such as this
Swarovski Crystal Chaplet of the Two Heartsor thisSt. Valentine Rosary.
Want to add to these Spiritual Gift ideas? Here are 10 gift ideas below!
1. St. Valentine Raspberry White Mocha - Medium Roast Coffee
2. Petite Multicolor Flower Rosary Bracelet
3. Padre Pio Kitchen Towel & Lenten Cookbook Gift Set
6. The Greatest Of These Is Love Dish Towel
7. White Wood Irish Love & Laughter Wall Cross
8. The Greatest Of These Is Love Candle
9. Square Letters "Love" Candle
10. St. Valentine Of Rome Purple February Rosary Bracelet
So, along with the candy, flowers, and fancy meals, add gifts of a spiritual nature on Valentine's Day.
Most of all, pray that you and all those you love will be together in heaven with Saint Valentine one day!

author: Huck Treadwell
title: Troy lowers cost for dual enrollment classes - The Troy Messenger | The Troy Messenger
text:
Troy University announced on Thursday it would lower the cost of dual enrollment classes for high school students by more than $100 per credit hour.
Beginning in January 2025, the cost of dual enrollment classes for in-state high school students will decrease to $33 per credit hour, down from the current $145 per credit hour. The lower price per credit hour will apply to all qualifying in-state students. Some counties in Florida and Georgia are also considered in-state.
“Troy University is enhancing access to higher education for high school students by offering affordable college level courses,” Senior Vice Chancellor of Student Services and Administration Sohail Agboatwala said. “This initiative gives students a valuable head start on their academic journey, allowing them to save time and money as they work toward their degrees. By prioritizing accessibility and quality, Troy reaffirms its dedication to empowering learners and building stronger connections with our communities.”
Dual enrollment at Troy is available to students in the 10th to 12th grade as well as home school and private school students from regionally accredited high schools. Students must have a 3.0 or higher GPA and score a 20 or better on the ACT, a 1030 on the SAT or provide a letter of recommendation from a high school administrator to apply for dual enrollment.
At Troy University, dual enrollment students are considered in-state students if they live in Alabama or in Bay, Calhoun, Escambia, Gulf, Holmes, Jackson, Okaloosa, Santa Rosa, Walton or Washington counties in Florida or in Baker, Calhoun, Chattahoochee, Clay, Decatur, Early, Harris, Heard, Macon, Marion, Meriweather, Miller, Muscogee, Quitman, Randolph, Schley, Seminole, Stewart, Talbot, Terrell, Troup, Upson or Webster counties in Georgia.
Troy University announced the decrease in enrollment at an on-campus luncheon for high School guidance counselors. Troy University Chancellor Jack Hawkins, Jr., spoke with the counselors about the price decrease and what it could mean for students.
“We have guidance counselors from this region, throughout this entire region and some from out of state [here today],” Hawkins said. “We want them to know about all of the resources available at Troy University. I think one of the more important roles in our high schools today is found in the counselor’s office because it’s there so many critical decisions are made in terms of the future of students.”
Hawkins went on to say that Troy University was one of the first universities in the nation to offer online education more than 30 years ago. He said online education allowed them to reach out to students they could have never reached without a physical campus. He said online education also helped lay the groundwork to reach high school students.
“What we want to do is make sure high school students know there is a path to the future,” Hawkins said. “That path begins in high school.”
KeLeigh Pritchett, Troy’s director of Dual Enrollment, said students selected to enroll in Troy’s Early College have a wide range of courses that allow them to receive high school and college credit at the same time. Those courses are designed to transfer to any college or university.
“When I think of Troy University, I think of generosity,” Pritchett said. “The affordability of our dual enrollment program provides quality educational opportunities to students who might not have the financial ability to take college level courses otherwise. Troy University prioritizes student success and strives to collaborate with outside partners to provide quality and engaging real world learning experiences. Our instructors believe in student centered learning which provides our dual enrollment students with a positive outlook on the collegiate experience.”
Jodie Jefcoat, Pike County Schools Dual Enrollment Coordinator, attended the meeting along with Goshen High School Guidance Counselor Brandi Lusk and Pike County Schools Career Coordinator Gina Maxwell.
Jefcoat said news of the price decrease would benefit the school system. She said about half of the eligible students in Pike County Schools were dual enrolled and the school system paid the dual enrollment tuition.
“It’s a huge financial savings for students and parents,” Jefcoat said. “It sets the student apart and puts them ahead of the game. Troy University has been awesome helping us with different degree plans. It helps students find their interest and they can earn a degree in a field they are interested in.”
For more information on dual enrollment, visit Early College .

title: 全國第一鮪今拍賣 美關稅恐衝擊買氣
text:
全國第一鮪今拍賣 美關稅恐衝擊買氣
蘇澳漁民捕獲今年全國第一鮪，今天上午將在南方澳第三拍賣魚市場拍賣。（記者江志雄攝）
〔記者江志雄、游太郎／綜合報導〕宜蘭縣蘇澳漁民捕獲全國第一鮪後，拉開一年一度黑鮪季，今年不巧遇上美國關稅風暴，國內外股市暴跌，漁界人士擔心買家縮手，影響買氣及價格。面臨關稅壓力，花蓮縣原定七日出口至美國的二萬斤鱸魚已被通知暫緩出貨。
蘇澳籍漁船全昌隆一六八號，六日在釣魚台海域捕獲一尾黑鮪魚，七日凌晨一點半搶先返回南方澳進港報關，之後吊上岸過磅有二一六公斤重，成為今年蘇澳第一鮪，也是全國第一鮪。漁會訂今天上午八點在南方澳第三拍賣魚市場開放承銷人競標。
今年蘇澳黑鮪季碰上美國總統川普祭出對等關稅大刀，股市大跌，蘇澳漁界人士憂心連帶波及黑鮪魚買氣，全國第一鮪競標價格被視為重要指標。
陳春生說，黑鮪魚屬於高端魚貨，消費力與經濟景氣息息相關，四到六月是產季，蘇澳區漁會將與縣府研擬多元促銷拉抬買氣，至於全國第一鮪競標，採自由市場機制標售，以平常心看待。
去年全國第一鮪也是由蘇澳漁民捕獲，重達二六九公斤，每公斤一萬三千一百元拍定，以三五二萬三千九百元成交。
因應川普對台課徵高達卅二％關稅，花蓮縣原定七日出口美國二萬斤鱸魚已被通知暫緩出貨，目前池子裡還有高達廿萬斤的存魚，漁民只能減少飼料投餵、壓低成本苦撐。
縣府農業處指出，吳郭魚、鱸魚為花蓮大宗水產養殖物種，攸關養殖戶家庭生計，面對關稅暴增與內需市場消費信心下滑雙重打擊，外銷美國訂單已全數獲通知暫緩。養殖戶蕭大慶希望政府儘快出面與美方協商，提出保護養殖漁業政策，並協助打開如歐盟等其他國家市場，以分散風險。

author: Bloomberg
title: AI Phones From Google and Apple Will Erode Trust in Everything
text:
AI Phones From Google and Apple Will Erode Trust in Everything
Google's new Pixel phones integrate advanced AI features that enable photo manipulation and call summaries, raising concerns about trust in digital content. With such capabilities, users may increasingly question the authenticity of what they see and hear online.
(Bloomberg Opinion) -- Alphabet Inc.'s [Google](https://tech.hindustantimes.com/tags/google) is racing to stuff its products with the most advanced artificial intelligence features, including some that will make you question everything you see and hear online. Itsnew Pixel phonesmake it easy to manipulate photos, adding people who weren't in the original shot or movingtheir positions. You'll be able to record phone calls, albeit with a disclosure tothe person on the other line, and get a detailed summary of the conversation. These cool, if creepy, features point to a disconcerting direction that AI tools are taking us in as they get built into more phones. The easier it is to manipulate the content we capture on our devices, the harder it'll be to trust what we see on them too.
For the new Pixel 9 phones, which go on sale on Aug. 22, Google has concentrated most of its AI prowess — abetted by the powerful G4 chip inside the phone — on the camera. The Add Me feature is billed as an alternative to the awkward angles and poses of the selfie. You take a photo of a friend, then get them to take a photo of you. Google's AI stitches the two soit looks like you werestanding together.
In the age of social media, where the statistical probability of looking at an untouched photo has diminished considerably, isn't that going to make it even harder to determine what's real? Not at all, according to Google's Rick Osterloh, who took charge of Google's Android platform earlier this year. In an interview with the Wall Street Journal, he said Google was simply allowing people to edit their real-life moments, and “store the memory how they want” — no different than Photoshop, he added.
[click here.](/mobile-finder)
It is in fact, very different. The vast majority of people who take photos with their phones don'tpay $23 a month to use Adobe Photoshop. But millions of people who are likely to buy new AI-enabled phones from [Apple](https://tech.hindustantimes.com/tags/apple) Inc., Samsung Electronics Co. and Google will be able to manipulate photos with a few taps. Apple's forthcoming iPhones will have a Clean Up tool toremove objects and people from photos. Samsung will let you move someone in a photo so it looks like they're facing someone else.
These features are marketed as conveniences, but they'll also make us more likely to question the accuracy and reality of photos far more than we do now. In his interview, Osterloh also defended a TV ad promoting Google's AI tool Gemini during the Olympics, in which a father encourages his young daughter to use AI to write a letter to an athlete to tell her “how inspiring she is.” Google was criticized for being tone deaf to the real reason parents help their kids write fan mail: the process of expressing gratitude. But according to Osterloh, this is just like the transition people made from sending hand-written thank you notes to emails. “This is a way to touch more people,” he said.
Also Read
[Google searches for deleting Facebook, Instagram, and Threads surge as Meta ends fact-checking policies: Report](/tech/news/google-searches-for-deleting-facebook-instagram-and-threads-surge-as-meta-ends-fact-checking-policies-report-71736499735419.html)[Apple caught secretly recording Siri conversations- How to disable Siri?](/tech/news/apple-caught-secretly-recording-siri-conversations-how-to-disable-siri-71735989836188.html)[Apple Intelligence on iPhone 16 Pro: After two months, here’s what I love and what I don't](/mobile/news/apple-intelligence-on-iphone-16-pro-after-two-months-here-s-what-i-love-and-what-i-dont-71736420848732.html)
Of course, the flip side of connecting with more people is that those people won't know if they're being “touched” by a human being at all.
Until now, the price of tech's latest conveniences has been money, personal data and attention. Use Google's services and you'll be subject to an online auction for your eyeballs that shares your personal data — location, browsing history, videos you've watched and more — with an array of different advertising networks for targeting. There's less of that on an Apple device, but you're still likely spending hours scrolling on one of the most addictive tools in human history if you have an iPhone.
The price we pay for tech's whizzy features seems subtle and abstract at first, but over time become clearer as they go mainstream. People around the world now spend about six hours a day on smartphones, often at the expense of sleep, kids or more fulfilling activities. More than 70% of companies in the US now collect personal data, according to Statista, and two-thirds of consumers around the world feel tech companies have too much control over those details, according to YouGov research.
What will the price be for a broader rollout of generative AI tools? Trust seems high up there, and not just of technology companies but increasingly of what we see online, including things that are real. When Donald Trump claimed that official photos of crowds at Kamala Harris rallies were AI generated, the rumor —which was false — spread to millions on X and other social platforms because of its plausibility. Like it or not, the growing ubiquity of AI phones will force us to become more wary of what we see and hear—unless we want manipulated versions of reality to be the new normal.
Parmy Olson is a Bloomberg Opinion columnist covering technology. A former reporter for the Wall Street Journal and Forbes, she is author of “Supremacy: AI, ChatGPT and the Race That Will Change the World.”

title: 何妤玟熱舞BLACKPINK經典歌 大小奶下垂還疑似走光
text:
圖、文／鏡週刊
▲何妤玟在節目上不經意露出大小奶。（翻攝自YouTube)
何妤玟一年前參加小S主持的《小姐不熙娣》錄影，在節目上穿著微露南、北半球的背心裙大跳韓女團BLACKPINK一員Rose的〈On the ground〉，上場跳舞前，何妤玟自曝說：「我有大小奶ㄟ ，而且我沒有擠也沒有弄，一切原始。」她為自已的演出先打預防針，沒想到在聊天過程中，被網友發現她右奶下垂且疑似走光。
走出離婚陰霾的何妤玟，難得在節目上大秀性感熱舞，她透露，因為女兒的關係才選擇了跳BLACKPINK的歌，對她來說是一大挑戰，且為了表現出Rose熱舞的酷勁，何妤玟臉上面無表情，保持酷樣，舞蹈動作大，也讓她的雙奶上下緣若隱若現，而小S則吐槽她跳舞像死掉，動作像蚌殼精，讓何妤玟相當無奈。
▲何妤玟右奶疑似走光。（翻攝自YouTube)
不過相較於舞蹈被評論，何妤玟微露出的大小奶更引人注目，尤其在雙手比劃之間，右奶的下半球頻頻往下垂，雙奶比重不均，更有網友放大截圖，指何妤玟疑似走光，引起不少討論，也發現節目組有幫何妤玟打碼遮奶，似乎也發現了她露的太多。

author: Ana Karen Velazquez
title: ¡Al estilo Street Fighter! Hombres protagonizan épica pelea en calles de Morelia y video se viraliza
text:
A pesar de que la mayoría de las personas sostienen que la violencia no es una solución efectiva para resolver conflictos , dos individuos en Morelia , Michoacán, decidieron ignorar este consejo. De manera similar a una escena de Street Fighter , famosa serie de videojuegos de lucha , desarrollada por la empresa japonesa Capcom, estos hombres fueron captados mientras protagonizaban una confrontación en calles del centro de Morelia.
Lee también: Chumel Torres critica furor de La Casa de los Famosos México: "todo el día peleando por un reality"
Captan a hombres protagonizando épica pelea en Morelia y se viraliza en redes En el material, que fue difundido a través de la plataforma X, anteriormente conocida como Twitter, se observa a estos hombres teniendo una confrontación física en plena calle, sin importar el tráfico vehicular ni la presencia de peatones, lo que ha captado la atención de varios usuarios debido a la intensidad del altercado.
Pese a que en la descripción del video no especifica el lugar exacto, de acuerdo con medios locales los hechos ocurrieron en la calle Virrey de Mendoza, entre Valladolid y Antonio Alzate, cerca de la tienda de telas Parisina y del acceso lateral de la Plaza de la Tecnología.
“Morelia”:
Por esta pelea que se registró ayer en Michoacán. pic.twitter.com/aTeDpYx0aK
— ¿Por qué es Tendencia? (@porktendencia) August 15, 2024 Lee también: Danna Paola graba brutal pelea entre vendedores en Tijuana: "vivímos una pelea épica"; VIDEO
Según internautas este conflicto se habría suscitado a raíz de un desacuerdo relacionado con un cliente; sin embargo, esta información aún no ha sido confirmada de manera oficial.
Aunque actualmente no se sabe cómo se originó exactamente esta pelea , lo que ha sorprendido a los espectadores fue la habilidad que demostró uno de los hombres, que llevaba una camisa azul, pues de acuerdo con ellos, el sujeto exhibió destrezas que han asociado con técnicas de artes marciales como el Karate o el Kung-fu .
Asimismo, han dejado varios comentarios como: "El de camisa azul ya está listo para la UFC, sabe boxeo, tae kwon do, kung fu y jiu jitsu", "Tiros limpios como en antaño, como Dios manda, se cae uno y el otro espera a que se levante", "La patada que dio el de azul es de crack", "El don de camisa, permitiendo que su rival se levante. Emulando al mismísimo Aquiles".

author: Dil Bar Irshad
title: New York Mosque Incident Sparks Outcry and Calls for Increased Worship House Security
text:
In the serene town of Melville, New York, an unexpected disturbance at a local mosque has ignited a fervent discussion on the state of religious tolerance and the safety of houses of worship in America. Last Wednesday, a confrontation that veered into the realm of Islamophobia transpired within the peaceful confines of the mosque, as a man, later identified as Jordan Endler, trespassed into the sacred space, embarking on an anti-Muslim tirade that shook the local community to its core.
A Disturbing Encounter
The incident unfolded as Endler entered the mosque, obscured his identity with a baseball cap, and began recording the worshippers. His demands for the release of 'Israeli hostages' and unfounded accusations labeling the Muslim congregants as 'racist' didn't just disrupt the tranquility of a place of worship but also laid bare the unsettling rise of anti-Muslim sentiment that has been simmering beneath the surface of American society. The swift response from law enforcement led to Endler's arrest on charges of trespassing and harassment, a small solace for those who witnessed his disturbing behavior.
CAIR-NY Raises the Alarm
The Council on American-Islamic Relations' New York chapter (CAIR-NY) was quick to condemn the incident, with Executive Director Afaf Nasher highlighting it as a glaring example of the broader issue of rising Islamophobia across the United States. Nasher pointed to the ongoing tensions following the war in Gaza as a catalyst for increased anti-Muslim rhetoric and actions, noting a significant uptick in requests for legal assistance received by CAIR-NY in 2023, many related to Palestinian solidarity. The alarming statistics from CAIR-NY's 2022 report, 'Feeling the Hate,' which revealed that 64% of Muslim New Yorkers experienced hate crimes or bias incidents, with a mere 4% reporting these to law enforcement, underscore the gravity of the situation and the urgent need for action.
Community and Beyond: A Call for Action
The aftermath of the Melville mosque incident has reverberated far beyond the local community, sparking a nationwide conversation on the safety of religious institutions and the imperative to combat religious bigotry. CAIR-NY's demand for enhanced security measures at houses of worship resonates with a broader call for solidarity and action against hate, urging not just the Muslim community but all Americans to stand in defense of the fundamental values of tolerance and freedom of religion. As the investigation continues, the unity and resilience shown by the Melville Islamic Center and its supporters offer a beacon of hope in the face of adversity, reminding us of the strength found in diversity and the power of collective action against intolerance.
